newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Japan-Australia j/vs seen as way to growth.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Japan-Australia j/vs seen as way to growth.

text.p: Promotion of Australia-Japan joint-ventures in Asia was a strategy decided on partly because of lack of growth in Australia-Japan trade, Shinroku Morohashi, chairman of Japan's giant Mitsubishi Corp, said after the Australia-Japan Business Cooperation Committees meeting.
Morohashi told a closing news conference that trade between Australia and Japan had peaked in 1995 at about US$22.7 billion.
The Mitsubishi chief said Japanese business saw it as important to press Australia to upgrade its processing, whether in beef or dairy products or building materials.
China's steel production was increasing enormously, but the country did not have high-quality iron ore, he said. Next century China would demand a huge amount of energy, he said.
China was looking at Australia with great interest for resources and investment, he said.
ASEAN economies formed another growth centre, he said.

Morohashi was speaking after the conference sessions, attended by 400 business people from Japan and Australia, settled on a main theme of joint-ventures between Australia and Japan, possibly in other markets in Asia.
